summary: Three transitive dependencies in the Rust core-bridge package contain security vulnerabilities (2 high severity DoS issues in rustls-webpki and 1 medium severity memory issue in rustix). This is an automated security alert that was repeatedly opened and closed as dependencies were updated.
userImpact: Users of the TypeScript SDK are vulnerable to CPU denial of service attacks via crafted certificate paths and potential memory exhaustion through directory iteration.
rootCause: Outdated transitive dependencies (rustls-webpki-0.100.1 and rustix-0.37.20) containing known security vulnerabilities in certificate validation and filesystem operations.
proposedFix: Upgrade rustls-webpki to version 0.100.2 or 0.101.4, and rustix to a patched version. Update remove_dir_all to ^0.8.0 as mentioned in comments.
resolutionDetails: Issue was resolved through dependency updates. The automated Mend scanner repeatedly confirmed closure as vulnerable libraries were removed from the inventory.
keyQuote: Can the remove_dir_all be updated to ^0.8.0 as this will fix the vulnerability. Latest version of remove_dir_all has been updated a week ago
